event.title: she++ Movie Night
event.desc: A showing of she++: Inspiring women to empower computer science. Check out the trailer here.

event.title: Women of Microsoft
event.desc: Four female Microsoft employees will share their stories on how they first got interested in technology, their roles at Microsoft, and the type of technology they work with every day. There will be opportunity to ask questions about how to prepare for a career in technology , what it’s like to work at Microsoft, and advice on preparing for work outside of college. Food will be provided!

event.title: Resume Workshop with Cisco
event.desc:
Cisco is excited to partner with Women in Computing and the Society of Women Engineers to bring you this event! Learn how to build an effective resume in order to apply to your dream company. Representatives (including UCSD Alumni) from various business units within Cisco will offer their professional advice, as well as discuss technical Internship and Full-Time positions available specifically for UCSD students. Food and beverages will be served.

Today more than 99% of our world is still not connected to the Internet. But we're working on it. Each day, more and more people, process, data and things join what we call the Internet of Everything. And as we wake up the world, amazing things will happen. Learn more at cisco.com

event.title: Professor Lunch and Q&A
event.desc:
Get advice from CSE professors! There will be a social after the panel where you can ask questions and hang out with the professors! All Undergraduate and Graduate students are welcome to attend. Food and caffeine will be provided!

Attending:

  • Dr. Christine Alvarado
  • Dr. Beth Simon
  • Dr. Cynthia Lee
  • Dr. Lingjia Tang

event.title: Build Your Own Website
event.desc:
Get started on creating your own personal website! You will be introduced to the basics of creating a web page whether it be for personal or professional reasons.

With DECAF coming up, you can be prepared by creating an online resume using HTML. Some of the benefits of creating an online resume include the ability to provide electronic links to your references and previous employers as well as providing links to previous jobs or projects you have been involved with. Handout

event.title: WIC Game Night
event.desc: Looking for something to do this Friday night? Join the WIC officers (past and present) for a night of games! We'll have board games and an Xbox Kinect. Its a great chance to meet all the officers and de-stress after midterms! Refreshments will be provided. Hope to see you there!

event.title: General Body Meeting (Winter 2013)
event.desc: Come hear about upcoming WIC events and see how you can participate!

event.title: Ooyala Tech Talk
event.desc:
Tech Talk: Concurrency at Scale by Austen McRae

Ooyala is the leader in online video management, publishing, analytics and monetization. Our integrated suite of technologies and services give content owners the power to expand audiences and the deep insights that drive increased viewer engagement and revenue from video. Ooyala serves hundreds of global media companies and marketers including Dell, ESPN, Fremantle Media, News International, Sephora, Telegraph Media Group, Vans, Whole Foods and Yahoo! Japan.

If you are still looking for a summer internship, they will be collecting resumes and interviewing promptly!

event.title: WIC Lunch With Yahoo!
event.desc: Yahoo! would like to have a low-key lunch with the undergraduate and graduate members of WIC.

event.title: WIC Programming Competition (Fall 2012)
event.desc: WIC's first ever programming competition, made just for students starting out in CS. In order to be eligible for this competition, you must have not taken or currently be enrolled in any upper division CSE courses. You are allowed to work with a partner. All coding will be in Java. First and second places get Amazon gift cards. 3rd-10th places get swag! Registration is now closed.

event.title: Applying to Grad School and Scholarships Talk
Kinect Social
event.desc: Hang out with officers, eat snacks, and play games on the Kinect!

event.title: Ice Cream Social
event.desc: Come to take a break from studying and socialize with other CSE students. WIC will be providing the ice cream and (if you want) you can bring your topping.

event.title: Speed Dating Mentoring
event.desc:
This program is designed for people in their first or second year of computer science to get advice from upperclassmen and grad students. Mentees will have the chance to speak with multiple mentors about many different CS related topics.

Come to find out more about the CSE department, the field of computer science, or to meet new people! We need both mentors and mentees.

event.title: SWE & WIC Intel Resume Workshop and Panel
event.desc:
Have you ever wanted to internship in a world leading company such as Intel? This is the GBM for you! Come and talk with people from Intel, making excellent working connections for your future career!

Not interested in Intel? That's okay! This is a great opportunity to make your resume standout in a tight economy. Ever wonder what happens after you’ve spent all that time posting your resume to every major on-line job board or to dozens of company web sites? Do actual human beings ever see it? Do you feel like it goes off into a perceived ‘black hole’ never to be seen again? We have information that will guarantee your resume gets noticed! A panel of resume experts from Intel will provide advice/tips on how to create an effective resume for any industry.
